wikipedia_page.main: Dawson Millward (July 13, 1870 – May 15, 1926) was a British stage and film actor.

response: * Dawson Millward (1870–1926), British stage and film actor
*1921 silent film, directed by B. E. Doxat-Pratt and starring Edmund Gwenn, Mary Clare, Helen Haye, Dawson Millward and Malcolm Keen.
* Dawson Millward as Sir Noel Barchester

King of the Castle is a 1926 British silent drama film directed by Henry Edwards and starring Marjorie Hume, Brian Aherne and Dawson Millward. It was based on a 1922 novel by Keble Howard, who approved the scenario and wrote some of the intertitles.

Caste was adapted for a 1915 British film directed by Laurence Trimble. Sir John Hare made his first appearance in motion pictures, reprising his acclaimed stage portrayal of Eccles. Other cast included Esme Hubbard (Polly Eccles), Campbell Gullan (Sam Gerridge), Peggy Hyland (Esther), Dawson Millward (Captain Hawtree), Roland Pertwee (George d'Alroy) and Mary Rorke (The Marquise) It is believed to be a lost film.
The Recoil is a 1922 British silent crime film directed by  Geoffrey Malins and starring  Annie Esmond, Lawrence Anderson and Dawson Millward.Goble p.924

The Eleventh Commandment is a 1921 play by Brandon Fleming. It premiered at the Playhouse Theatre, Cardiff before transferring to the Royalty Theatre in London's West End where it ran for 32 performances between 16 January and 11 February 1922. The original West End cast included Henry Stoker, Edmund Breon, Dawson Millward and Viola Tree.Wearing p. 142
